body:
Thanks for raising the issue.

We'll do our best to look into this in time for 5.3.

Using `@JvmField` instead of `@JvmStatic` works, otherwise Kotlin generates a private field which we filter out.

@stefano-m Would you be interested in documenting this in the User Guide?

rename.from: Kotlin: BeforeAllCallback Programmatic Extension Registration does not seem work
rename.to: Document how to use @RegisterExtension for static extensions from Kotlin

body: I changed the issue title to improve documentation.

> Using @JvmField instead of @JvmStatic works, otherwise Kotlin generates a private field which we filter out.

Awesome! I'm going to try that out ASAP.

> Would you be interested in documenting this in the User Guide?

@marcphilipp I can surely do that, but I'd need a pointer or two to get started.

Thanks!

> I can surely do that, but I'd need a pointer or two to get started.

Basically, I think we should add a short paragraph and a sample here:
https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#extensions-registration-programmatic-static-fields

The source code for that lives in the documentation subproject:
https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/documentation/src/docs/asciidoc/user-guide/extensions.adoc#static-fields

See https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/aae5f5df3053dc45de1eb32fae864973dccc51d3/documentation/README.md for details.

@stefano-m Does that help?
Hi, the issue went off my radar due to other commitments, but hopefully I'll have some free time to do it in the next couple of days.

@stefano-m, thanks for getting back to us.

If you can tackle this soon, we might be able to squeeze it into 5.3. Otherwise, it'll go into 5.4.
